column4: hi everyone. Can anybody help me, I want to know if can reinstall ubuntu without losing my files and the packages I've already installed?
just copy the /home directory, and maybe /var and /etc to a disk
/home probably would do it, but global configurations are in /etc, and some things (nethack) save stuff in /var
That's good to know. I have /home in  a partition
smart move. Just remember to not format /home during the reinstall
Great, but could I be 100% sure I won't lose anything?
can I be 100% sure I won't lose anything?
well, if you have disks, you could back up everything.
that's what I don't want to do for a second time, and lose my configuration and installed programs too
this is becoming a nigthmare, but I'm still in love with Ubuntu
well, I'd think that the /home stuff, you don't need to back up if you're careful when reinstalling
why are you reinstalling, if I might ask?

because I'm having problems with the configuration of video, a couple of repositories with problems, and now I have problems trying to follow this HowTo (sorry it's in Spanish): http://elmodem.wordpress.com/2006/11/09/como-compilar-el-kernel-de-kubuntu/
argh...I left Spanish in senior year...Well, the big problem is, it's your programs that are causing the problems, so saving all your programs would give you another system with the same problems
I'm losing too much time trying to get help and solve the problems
thank you anyway, I'm leaving now
